Cf [[Know the elements of aetiological orientation of acute infectious diarrhoea|table]]

In children, viral watery diarrhoea is often accompanied by fever (especially rotavirus).

Clostridium difficile diarrhoea is rare in children and (almost) non-existent before the age of 4 because of the absence of a toxin receptor. On the other hand, children are readily colonised by C. difficile, including toxin-secreting organisms. it is therefore unnecessary to test young children for C. difficile.

question.title: What is the reason why Clostridium difficile diarrhoea is rare in children under the age of 4?

option_a.title: Because children under 4 have a strong immune system

option_b.title: Because children under 4 have a mature gut microbiome

option_c.title: Because children under 4 are less likely to be exposed to C. difficile

option_d.title: Because children under 4 have a higher risk of developing antibiotic-resistant strains of C. difficile

correct_option.title: The correct option
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
